== Main Inclusion Report for Libzip ==

=== Requirements ===

# ''Availability:'' <nowiki>[[http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/pool/universe/libz/libzip]]</nowiki>; available for all supported architectures or some subset ?
# ''Rationale:''
** Build dependency of kdeutils
 0. ''Security:''
** <nowiki>[[http://cve.mitre.org/cgi-bin/cvekey.cgi?keyword=libzip|CVE entries]]</nowiki>: None
** <nowiki>[[http://secunia.com/search/?search=libzip|Secunia history]]</nowiki>: None
** No binaries running as root or suid/sgid. No daemons 
** Network activity: does not open any port  Does not handle incoming network data 
** Does  directly process binary (zip files) data
** No known any source code review performed
 0. ''Quality assurance:''
** Always works out of the box without configuration 
** Does not ask any debconf questions
** <nowiki>[[http://bugs.debian.org/src:libzip|Debian bugs]]</nowiki>: none
** <nowiki>[[http://packages.qa.debian.org/libz/libzip.html|Maintenance in Debian]]</nowiki> is calm
** <nowiki>[[http://www.nih.at/libzip/|Upstream]]</nowiki> is active
** No known Upstream bug tracker
** Hardware: Does not deal with hardware
** There is no test suite in the upstream source or packaging
 0. ''Standards compliance:'' 
** <nowiki>[[http://www.pathname.com/fhs/|FHS]]</nowiki>, <nowiki>[[http://www.de.debian.org/doc/debian-policy/|Debian Policy]]</nowiki> compliant
** <nowiki>[[http://www.netfort.gr.jp/~dancer/column/libpkg-guide/libpkg-guide.html|Debian library packaging guide]]</nowiki> standards compliant
** Packaging system cdbs. quilt patch system 
 0. ''Dependencies:''
** zlib1g
** All in main
 0. ''Background information:''
** The general purpose and context of the package is clear from the package's debian/control file.
** Upstream call it libzip
